item.title: #TIL 2018-01-04 : Sleeping connections in MySQL
item.description: Sleeping connections in MySQL When you check your MySQL process list via command show processlist;, it will show you a useful table which provide all current connection details. “Sleep” state connections are most connection pointer waiting for the timeout to terminate. Then they still count as a connection. (Can cause MySQL connection limit error, which default equal 150 connections) So next time, remember to close your connection before terminating your app.

item.title: #TIL 2017-02-28 : Persistent connection to MySQL

item.title: #TIL 2015-12-01 : Index is useless when use function on indexed field
item.description: Index is useless when use function on indexed field Reality, if using function on indexed field, you will broke indexing by accident. Eg: WHERE MONTH(`date`) = 11 AND YEAR(`date`) = 2015 Solution is transform the query to comparison query, like this : WHERE `date` >= '2015-11-01' AND `date` < '2015-12-01'
